{"step_by_step_thinking": "The crossed extensor reflex is a reflex in which the contralateral limb compensates for loss of support when the ipsilateral limb withdraws from painful stimulus in a withdrawal reflex. This reflex is also associated with maintaining balance and posture when one side of the body experiences a stimulus. Therefore, it can be considered as a type of withdrawal reflex that also has a role in maintaining posture.", "answer_choice": "B. Postural reflex"}
